business.headline: Sensex, Nifty opening on June 26: Will stock market rise again today?As of 8:24 am, the Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,287 points. This suggests that the Nifty50 could open around its previous close of 25,244.75.

Stocks to watch on June 26: SBI, Tata Steel, One Mobikwik, Adani EnterprisesStrong global signals and a steady flow of news from domestic companies helped keep investor sentiment upbeat as Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 1% in the last session.
Adani Total Gas and Jio-bp partner to expand fuel access across IndiaThis collaboration will see Jio-bp's premium petrol and diesel sold at select Adani fuel outlets, according to ATGL's statement.
Sensex closes 700 points higher, Nifty above 25,200, Titan up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 700.40 points to end at 82,755.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 200.40 points to close at 25,244.75.

Jewellery vs gold ETFs: How to make make money shine, not just wrists, explains CAGold jewellery may look beautiful, but it often comes with hidden costs, resale hassles, and emotional attachment that cloud financial judgement.

Planning to buy a house? This is India's most affordable city in 2025A report from Knight Frank India's latest Affordability Index highlights that RBI's decision to cut the repo rate by 100 basis points since February 2025 has played a key role in improving housing affordability across the country.

Want SIP success? Do this every month, says stock market expertSIP calculators do a fine job of showing projections. However, they don't account for emotions, self-doubt, or the unpredictability of life, mentioned a stock market expert.
GST Council meeting: What to expect from upcoming meet?The previous GST Council meeting took place on December 21, 2024, in Jaisalmer. Since then, many matters have remained pending.

8 key documents you must keep ready before filing your ITR for FY 2024–25One of the first documents you'll need is Form 16, which your employer gives you. It shows your total salary, how much tax was deducted, and what deductions were claimed.

EPFO raises auto-settlement limit to Rs 5 lakh for faster fund accessIn the fiscal year 2024-25, the EPFO processed a record 2.34 crore advance claims through the auto-settlement process, marking a 161% increase compared to the previous year.
Sensex jumps 700 points: Why is the stock market rising today? The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 722.55 points to 82,777.66, while the NSE Nifty50 added 209.15 points to 25,253.50 as of 2:25 pm.

HDB Financial opens today: Should you subscribe to the biggest IPO of 2025?HDB Financial IPO: The public listing consists of a fresh issue of 3.38 crore shares worth Rs 2,500 crore, and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of 13.51 crore shares, totalling Rs 10,000 crore.

entertainment.headline: Diljit must apologise, remove objectionable scenes: Mika Singh amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowSinger-rapper Mika Singh, in another post, said that he is willing to forgive Diljit Dosanjh if he apologises. He called him a 'fake' singer and lashed out at him for working with a Pakistani actor in 'Sardaar Ji 3'.

Netflix drops season 2 of The Ultimatum: Queer Love, set in MiamiNetflix's The Ultimatum: Queer Love returns for Season 2 in vibrant Miami, exploring love and commitment among six queer couples in a bold relationship test.
Fitness influencer 'Liver King' arrested after threatening Joe Rogan onlineFitness influencer Liver King Brian Johnson was arrested in Austin for threatening Joe Rogan on social media.

Perfect Match season 3: Netflix announces cast and release schedulePerfect Match Season 3 premieres August 1 on Netflix, featuring stars from The Bachelor, Love Island, and more in a high-stakes dating showdown.

Film body slams Diljit Dosanjh's casting in Border 2 amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowThe Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) has condemned Diljit Dosanjh's casting in 'Border 2'. This move highlights ongoing tensions over collaborations with Pakistani artistes and national sentiment.

Pak actor was signed before Pahalgam attack: Sardaarji 3 makers on Hania Amir rowAmid a raging controversy, the makers of 'Sardaarji 3', on Wednesday, clarified that Pakistani actor Hania Amir was signed before the Pahalgam attack. The film is headlined by actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh.

Panchayat writer Chandan Kumar says direction for Season 5 is almost done'Panchayat' writer Chandan Kumar says the direction for Season 5 is almost done. The fourth season of the TVF series premiered on Prime Video on June 24.

After Srikanth's arrest, Tamil actor Krishna questioned by police in drug caseTamil actor Krishna was questioned by the police in connection with the ongoing drug abuse investigation. Earlier, actor Srikanth was arrested under four sections of the Narcotics Control Act.

Son of Sardaar 2: Ajay Devgn unveils new poster with star-studded castAjay Devgn unveiled the poster of 'Son of Sardaar 2', titled 'The Return of the Sardaar'. The film will be released in theatres on July 25, 2025.

Aayush Sharma undergoes two surgeries, says good health isn't just about six-packsActor Aayush Sharma recently underwent two back surgeries following an injury sustained while performing a stunt in 'Ruslaan'. He shared an emotional post about learning to prioritise health and returning stronger for his family and fans.

Aamir Khan's Coolie cameo features intense 15-minute face-off: ReportRajinikanth's 'Coolie' will feature a high-octane 15-minute climax with Aamir Khan in a powerful cameo role. The action-packed face-off between the two stars is set to be one of the film's biggest highlights.

Taylor Swift stuns with surprise Shake It Off performance at Travis Kelce's concertTaylor Swift lit up Travis Kelce's Tight End University concert in Nashville with a surprise performance of 'Shake It Off'. The unexpected moment thrilled fans and NFL stars attending the multi-day event.

Choo Young-woo and Cho Yi-hyun on Head Over Heels, love for Indian fans'Head Over Heels' is a captivating K-drama, starring Choo Young-woo and Cho Yi-hyun, who share their thoughts on fate and love in an exclusive interview. The actors express their admiration for their roles and convey heartfelt messages to their growing audience in India.

R Madhavan jokes about looking young on screen: Don't have the budget for de-agingActor R Madhavan opened up about his secret of looking youthful in an interaction with the media on Wednesday. The actor said people have been accusing him of de-aging.

Chikitu: Rajinikanth's brief appearance in Coolie music video steals the showA new song from superstar Rajinikanth's much-anticipated film 'Coolie' was released on Wednesday. Titled 'Chikitu', the track features T Rajendar, Anirudh Ravichander, Sandy, and Arivu, with a brief appearance by Rajinikanth.

Actor Joe Marinelli, known for General Hospital, dies of stomach cancer at 68Popular soap actor Joe Marinelli, best known for 'General Hospital' and 'Santa Barbara', has died at 68. He was diagnosed with throat and stomach cancer a few years ago.

K-drama actor Choi Yoon-ra announces pregnancy, flaunts baby bump in new picsKorean actor Choi Yoon-ra recently shared heartwarming pregnancy pictures on social media. She also revealed that she is expecting a baby girl.

Lakshmi Manchu says art and politics should be kept separate amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowActor Lakshmi Manchu recently shared her views on the ban on Pakistani actors. She stated that art and politics should not be mixed.

The Traitors makers announce Season 2 of Karan Johar's reality show'The Traitors' will make a comeback with fresh faces and a brand-new season. The makers of the show announced Season 2 on Instagram on Wednesday.

general news.headline: Op Sindoor was our right to counter Pak-sponsored terror: Rajnath Singh in ChinaDefence Minister Rajnath Singh said that Operation Sindoor was a series of pre-emptive strikes launched on May 7, aimed at 'deterring further cross-border terrorist attacks' and 'dismantling cross-border terrorist infrastructure' in Pakistan.

12 killed in mass shooting during street celebration in Mexico's GuanajuatoAt least 12 people were killed and 20 injured when gunmen opened fire during a street celebration in Irapuato, Guanajuato, highlighting ongoing violence linked to organised crime groups.

100% lunatic: Trump rages after Zohran Mamdani wins New York mayoral primaryDonald Trump launched a furious attack on Zohran Mamdani after the 33-year-old Democratic socialist won NYC's mayoral primary. Calling him a "100% Communist Lunatic," he also mocked Mamdani's appearance and allies, while warning that Democrats are pushing the country toward extreme left politics.

'Silver dinner plates, Rs 5,000 per meal': Maharashtra government event sparks rowAn event hosted by the Maharashtra government has come under the scanner after guests were served meals on silver plates, despite the state facing strain. However, sources refuted claims of the government hosting a "lavish" party.

Prada ignored India. Louis Vuitton put it centre stage at Paris Fashion Week French luxury brand LV's creative director and rapper Pharrell Williams put on a show that openly celebrated India, a move that LV's contemporaries (hello, Prada) should certainly take cues from.

Navy staffer arrested for spying for Pakistan, received payments via cryptoThe accused was in regular contact with a Pakistani female handler, who allegedly lured him with money in exchange for critical strategic information from naval operations, on social media.

Mahayuti rift widens as Devendra Fadnavis issues orders against ministers' staffMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis cracked down against the unauthorised retention of Personal Secretaries (PS) and Officers on Special Duty (OSDs) by several ministers from Shiv Sena and the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP).

Stopped nuclear war: Trump repeats India-Pak truce claim, Congress slams BJPThe US President's latest claim came despite Prime Minister Narendra Modi clarifying days ago that America had no role in reaching a truce between India and Pakistan after three days of military conflict following the Pahalgam terror attack.

Transition no excuse: India needs to take World Test Championship seriouslyEngland vs India: India are a team in transition, and the Headingley Test can be seen as a minor blip in their journey as a side. However, transition cannot be used as an excuse for the poor display at vital moments in a game that India could have easily won.
Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) SystemThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

Shubhanshu Shukla launched into orbit, Space Station docking nextAs the Falcon-9 delivered the Crew Dragon into space, the four astronauts will now work towards catching the Space Station which is flying above them.

Trump, Iran, and 'daddy' drama: Nato summit gets weirdNATO Secretary General Mark Rutte clarified he didn't call Donald Trump "daddy," saying he used the term to explain how countries ask if the US will stay committed to NATO. Rutte praised Trump for his decisive strike on Iran's nuclear sites.
Video: Ahmedabad woman dies after being hit by truck, dragged 20 feetA truck driver was arrested after he hit a woman riding a scooter and dragged her for about 20 feet on a busy road in Ahmedabad.
Who won the 12-day Israel-Iran war?Netanyahu, Khamenei and Donald Trump battle for top honours

Ridiculous witch hunt: Trump demands immediate end to Netanyahu's graft trialDonald Trump defended Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu, calling his trial a witch hunt and demanding it be cancelled. In a Truth Social post, Trump praised Netanyahu as a warrior who helped stop Iran's nuclear threat and said the charges against him are politically motivated.

Zelenskyy switches to formals at Nato summit months after Oval Office fiascoUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy opted for a rugged black suit-style jacket and shirt at the Nato summit. This came months after he was slammed by a reporter for not wearing a suit during his February meeting with Donald Trump at the Oval Office.

Noida HR's post on candidate resigning on day 1 sparks debate on work cultureAlthough the HR professional acknowledged that the job was challenging, she said that all details had been clearly discussed before the offer was made.

Iran halts cooperation with UN atomic agency after US-Israel strikes on nuke sitesIran's Parliament has voted to suspend cooperation with the UN's nuclear watchdog, the IAEA, following recent Israeli airstrikes on its nuclear sites. Meanwhile, Tehran vowed to speed up its peaceful nuclear program and demanding better protection for its facilities.

Live: Trump says US to hold nuclear talks with Iran next weekIran-Israel conflict live updates: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called the 12-day conflict with Iran a historic victory, even as a leaked US report claimed American airstrikes only briefly delayed Iran's nuclear program. The intense clash ended with a Trump-brokered ceasefire. Netanyahu maintained that Israel had successfully disrupted Iran's nuclear ambitions and pledged to respond forcefully to any future threats. While Iran continued to deny pursuing nuclear weapons, it agreed to halt retaliatory actions if Israel ended its airstrikes. The truce came after Trump ordered bunker-buster strikes on Iranian nuclear sites, saying they crippled Tehran's capabilities. CIA Director John Ratcliffe backed this, saying the damage would take Iran years to repair. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

What it takes to make love last after 60In between building a life and raising a family, do couples lose the script of how to grow old together? Experts say it is normal. It is not about chasing sparks but keeping the warmth alive.

Pak actor was signed before Pahalgam attack: Sardaarji 3 makers on Hania Amir rowAmid a raging controversy, the makers of 'Sardaarji 3', on Wednesday, clarified that Pakistani actor Hania Amir was signed before the Pahalgam attack. The film is headlined by actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh.

Gill lacked authority in Leeds, claims former spinner: Had too many captainsFormer India spinner-turned commentator Murali Kartik feels Shubman Gill lacked authority as a leader during the first Test against England at Headingley, Leeds.

Multiple flash floods triggered by cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh, 2 deadEmergency responders, district administration officials, and police personnel reached the spot and took stock of the situation on the ground.

I was panicking: Rohit on how Virat calmed dressing room in T20 World Cup finalRohit Sharma reflected on the dramatic turn of events in the T20 World Cup 2024 final, heaping praise on the match-winning knocks of Virat Kohli and Axar Patel. He described the triumph in Barbados as the greatest moment of his career.

sports.headline: Michael Vaughan taunts Wasim Jaffer, predicts 4-0 England sweepFormer England captain Michael Vaughan, known for his spirited banter with former Indian opener Wasim Jaffer on X (formerly Twitter), didn't miss the chance to take a dig after India's five-wicket defeat in the first Test at Headingley. Seizing the moment, Vaughan not only poked fun at Jaffer but also revised his series prediction, calling for a 4-0 win in England's favour.

Transition no excuse: India needs to take World Test Championship seriouslyEngland vs India: India are a team in transition, and the Headingley Test can be seen as a minor blip in their journey as a side. However, transition cannot be used as an excuse for the poor display at vital moments in a game that India could have easily won.

Seales, Shamar shine against Australia on 14-wicket opening dayJayden Seales and Shamar Joseph evoked memories of West Indies' legendary pace attacks, dismantling Australia for just 180 on a lively Kensington Oval pitch on day one of the first Test. Australia hit back through Mitchell Starc, Pat Cummins, and Josh Hazlewood, who shared four wickets to leave West Indies struggling at 57 for four at stumps.

Gill lacked authority in Leeds, claims former spinner: Had too many captainsFormer India spinner-turned commentator Murali Kartik feels Shubman Gill lacked authority as a leader during the first Test against England at Headingley, Leeds.

Rishabh Pant is reinventing batsmanship, reminds of Gilchrist: Greg ChappellFormer Australia cricketer Greg Chappell has showered praise on India's wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant, saying that he's reinventing the game.

Rishabh Pant was the only one who contacted me during tough times: Prithvi ShawIndia and Mumbai batter Prithvi Shaw revealed that he only received support from Rishabh Pant during the tough phase of his career. Shaw has been going through tumultuous times in his professional life as he found no bidders during the IPL 2025 auction.

IPL: Rajasthan Royals owner accuses former co-owner of blackmail in UK courtLondon-based venture capitalist Manoj Badale and his company Emerging Media Ventures are suing businessman Raj Kundra at London's High Court for allegedly breaching a 2019 confidential settlement agreement.

Sam Konstas fails on return as Shamar Joseph decimates top orderWI vs AUS, 1st Test: Australia's returning opener Sam Konstas and new No. 3 Cameron Green failed in the first hour on Day 1. Pacers Shamar Joseph and Jayden Seales made the most of helpful conditions on Wednesday morning in Barbados.

Sri Lanka dominate proceedings as Bangladesh collapse on Day 1 in ColomboSri Lanka had a dominating Day 1 of the second Test against Bangladesh in Colombo as they left them reeling at 220/8 at the stumps. Asitha Fernando (2/43), Vishwa Fernando (2/35) and Sonal Dinusha (2/22) emerged as top performers from the day.

Harshit Rana released from Test squad, day after Gambhir's clarification: ReportFast bowler Harshit Rana has been released from India's Test squad before the second Test in Birmingham. He did not travel with the rest of the team, which left for Birmingham from Leeds on Wednesday, June 25.

How Ravi Shastri's booming voice made Rohit forget toss coin, batter revealsIndia ODI captain Rohit Sharma recently revealed how Ravi Shastri made him forget the coin toss during the blockbuster clash against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2024.

IPL: Rajasthan Royals owner accuses former co-owner of blackmail in UK courtLondon-based venture capitalist Manoj Badale and his company Emerging Media Ventures are suing businessman Raj Kundra at London's High Court for allegedly breaching a 2019 confidential settlement agreement.

Sam Konstas fails on return as Shamar Joseph decimates top orderWI vs AUS, 1st Test: Australia's returning opener Sam Konstas and new No. 3 Cameron Green failed in the first hour on Day 1. Pacers Shamar Joseph and Jayden Seales made the most of helpful conditions on Wednesday morning in Barbados.

Asitha Fernando (2/43), Vishwa Fernando (2/35) and Sonal Dinusha (2/22) emerged as top performers from the day.

Harshit Rana released from Test squad, day after Gambhir's clarification: ReportFast bowler Harshit Rana has been released from India's Test squad before the second Test in Birmingham. He did not travel with the rest of the team, which left for Birmingham from Leeds on Wednesday, June 25.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
